history.content:
This depends on how much electromagnetism you have done previously. EE117 is for people who is familiar with electromagnetostatics and knows the basics of Maxwell’s equation. If you have strong background from high school, then you can take both together. Also, math 53 is a must because modern electrodynamics relies heavily on multivariable calculus (divergence theorem and stoke’s theorem) and PDEs (Wave equation and Poisson equation).

A good reference is Introduction to Electrodynamics by Griffith. If you know 50-70% of the topics already, you are probably good to take EE117.

children.subject: sorry, I meant to type stoke’s theorem.
Minor nitpick: Stone's theorem is a result in functional analysis, you may be thinking of Green's theorem

history.content: Can physics 7b be taken concurrently with ee 117 (electromagnetic fields and waves) or is it recommended to have finished physics 7b prior to taking this class?
history.subject: ee 117 prerequisites
